intro: Cyrtandra angustielliptica, commonly known as the narrow-elliptic cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Cyrtandra angustielliptica is often found in Hawaii and other parts of Southeast Asia.
